metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0466 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The fixps script in a2ps 4.14 does not use the -dSAFER option when executing gs, which allows context-dependent attackers to delete arbitrary files or execute arbitrary commands via a crafted PostScript file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0466` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

a2ps - 1:4.14-1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: a2ps package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.14-1.3').
